newsitem.title: USA: EIS lays off 100, sees charges in restructuring.
newsitem.headline: EIS lays off 100, sees charges in restructuring.

text.p: EIS International Inc. said Monday it will discontinue Surefind, its Pittsburgh online data backup and recovery services business, and lay off about a fourth of its estimated staff of 400 employees.
EIS, a major provider of call centre management software, systems and services, said the restructuring will result in charges in the next two quarters.
Many of the layoffs were effective Friday, and others go into effect Monday, it said.
The Herndon, Va.-based company's systems business includes its call centre management software and services, such as software that handles outbound telemarketing.
Senior Vice President Carol Blaszczynski said the company would detail fourth-quarter charges when it releases financial results at month's end.
As part of the restructuring, the company will close its corporate office in Pittsburgh and downsize Cybernetics, which develops and sells the "Workforce Manager" management product.
The company said it will also close a facility in Coral Gables, Fla., and integrate Pulse, its Chantilly, Va.-based subsidiary, into its systems business.
EIS's stock rose 25 cents to $6.125 on Nasdaq in early afternoon trading.
